IXO RAM040 Citroën Xsara 2001 Tour de Corse – Rallye de France Winner J. Puras/M. Martí

Only WRC win for Jesús Puras
3rd WRC win for Citroën
First WRC win for Xsara



The Citroën works team first participated in the WRC in 1984 with the Citroën Visa. None of their cars finished either of the 2 rallies contested that year. They had a much better record in 1985 when 2 of the 3 Visas finished the only rally contested that year - the Rallye Monte Carlo. In 1986 Citroën introduced their Group B car - the BX 4TC - and scored one 6th place finish out of 7 entries in the 3 rallies contested that year. A pretty dismal 3 years of rallying.

Then they took a break from the WRC and focused on rally raid instead. The first ZX Rallye Raid prototypes appeared in 1990 with a maiden win in the Dakar the following year and subsequent victories in 1994, 1995, and 1996. Citroën also won the rally raid Constructors’ Championship 5 years in a row from 1993 - 1997. Despite great success in rally raid, Citroën withdrew from competition at the end of the 1997 season (which surely made the competition happy).

In 1998 it was back to the WRC in the Xsara. The front-wheel drive Xsara Kit Car was entered on asphalt rounds of the WRC in 1998 & 1999 with Citroën getting their first (& second) wins in 2000. Things were starting to look better for Citroën's WRC effort. Then they took a break and did not compete in any WRC events while they developed a full WRC-spec Xsara. The new Xsara debuted in round 4 of the 2001 WRC season in the Rallye Catalunya - Costa Brava.

Sebastian Loeb made his debut in the Xsara WRC in round 11 in Sanremo and, surprisingly, did not win the rally. In the next race - the Tour de Corse - 7-time Spanish Rally Championship winner Jesús Puras drove the Xsara WRC to it’s maiden victory. Puras & co-driver Marc Martí took the overall lead in stage 2 and held on to it for the rest of the rally. While this was Puras’ only WRC win he did go on to win Spanish Rally Championship #8 the next year.
